android.gameengine.icadroids.tiles

Class Tile

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.gameengine.icadroids.tiles.Tile

  • public class Tile
extends java.lang.Object
    Every tile in a tilemap is a tile object. You can manipulate the tile by using its methods. Note: tile objects will be automatically generated by GameTiles
    Author:
    Bas van der Zandt

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Tile(int tileType, GameTiles gameTiles)
      Every tile has a tiletype and is a instance of an gameTiles object.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      GameTiles getGameTiles()
      Get the instance of gameTiles where this Tile is a instance from
      int getTileNumberX()
      Get the x tile number in the tile map
      int getTileNumberY()
      Get the y tile number in the tile map
      int getTileType()
      Get the tile tiletype
      int getTileX()
      Get the x position of the tile Note: x and y values are at the top left corner of the tile
      int getTileY()
      get the y position of the tile Note: x and y values are at the top left corner of the tile
      (package private) void setTileIndex(int i, int j)
      Set the position of the tile in the tilemap, as index, not real world coordinates
      void setTileType(int tileType)
      Change the tile type
      Important! Use this method only when you want to change a tile into another tile.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tile

        public Tile(int tileType,
            GameTiles gameTiles)
        Every tile has a tiletype and is a instance of an gameTiles object. Tiletype lower than 0 means invisible.
        Parameters:
        tileType -
        gameTiles -

    • Method Detail

      • setTileType

        public void setTileType(int tileType)
        Change the tile type
        Important! Use this method only when you want to change a tile into another tile. If you want to remove tiles or add tiles at certain positions, use the GameTiles.changeTile method.
        Parameters:
        tileType - the new tiletype
        See Also:
        GameTiles.changeTile(int, int, int)

      • getTileType

        Get the tile tiletype

        the tiletype

      • getTileNumberY

        public int getTileNumberY()
        Get the y tile number in the tile map
        Returns:
        The y tile number

      • setTileIndex

        void setTileIndex(int i,
                  int j)
        Set the position of the tile in the tilemap, as index, not real world coordinates
        Parameters:
        i - the first index in the double array of the tilemap, that is Y-index
        j - the second index in the double array of the tilemap, that is X-index

      • getGameTiles

        public GameTiles getGameTiles()
        Get the instance of gameTiles where this Tile is a instance from
        Returns:
        gameTile object

      • getTileX

        public int getTileX()
        Get the x position of the tile Note: x and y values are at the top left corner of the tile
        Returns:
        the x position in the game world

      • getTileY

        public int getTileY()
        get the y position of the tile Note: x and y values are at the top left corner of the tile
        Returns:
        the y position in the game world
